H0.text: The nervous system controls all five senses.

H1.text: The circulatory system controls all five senses.

H2.text: Skin cells control all five senses.

H3.text: The endocrine system controls all five senses.

A4.text: The sensory nervous system is a part of the nervous system responsible for processing sensory information.

A5.text: For the five traditional senses in humans, this includes the primary and secondary cortices of the different senses: the somatosensory cortex, the visual cortex, the auditory cortex, the primary olfactory cortex, and the gustatory cortex.
